headline.main: Jones Defends England Aggression After Cheika's 'Niggle' Swipe
headline.print_headline: Jones Defends England Aggression After Cheika's 'Niggle' Swipe

docs.snippet: England coach Eddie Jones has defended his team's aggression ahead of the second test in Melbourne after his Australia counterpart Michael Cheika accused the tourists of questionable off-the-ball tactics during the series-opener in Brisbane....
docs.lead_paragraph: England coach Eddie Jones has defended his team's aggression ahead of the second test in Melbourne after his Australia counterpart Michael Cheika accused the tourists of questionable off-the-ball tactics during the series-opener in Brisbane.

headline.main: From Great Britain to Little England
headline.print_headline: From Great Britain to Little England

docs.snippet: Campaigners for leaving the European Union want to “take back control.” But what will they be left with?...
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by author Neal Ascherson underscores how British referendum on whether to exit European Union pits idea of nation as Great Britain versus idea of nation as Little England; argues isolation should Brexit succeed will make nation worse, as it has in past.
docs.lead_paragraph: Campaigners for leaving the European Union want to “take back control.” But what will they be left with?

headline.main: Dow Chemical First Foreign Company to Get Saudi Arabia Trading License
headline.print_headline: Dow Chemical First Foreign Company to Get Saudi Arabia Trading License

docs.snippet: Dow Chemical Co said it became the first foreign company to receive a trading license from Saudi Arabia as the kingdom plans to diversify its economy and free its dependence on oil exports amid a slump in global oil prices....
docs.lead_paragraph: Dow Chemical Co said it became the first foreign company to receive a trading license from Saudi Arabia as the kingdom plans to diversify its economy and free its dependence on oil exports amid a slump in global oil prices.

headline.main: Missouri Man Gets Probation for Online Threats to Blacks
headline.print_headline: Missouri Man Gets Probation for Online Threats to Blacks

docs.snippet: A man who posted threatening messages against black people on an anonymous social media app during racial protests at the University of Missouri last year has been sentenced to probation....
docs.lead_paragraph: A man who posted threatening messages against black people on an anonymous social media app during racial protests at the University of Missouri last year has been sentenced to probation.

headline.main: Convicted Lottery Computer Manager Argues Iowa Court Appeal
headline.print_headline: Convicted Lottery Computer Manager Argues Iowa Court Appeal

docs.lead_paragraph: The attorney for a former lottery official accused of fixing jackpots in several states argued Thursday that his client's conviction last year on fraud charges should be thrown out.

headline.main: Lewis Loses No-Hit Bid vs A's on Leadoff Double in 9th
headline.print_headline: Lewis Loses No-Hit Bid vs A's on Leadoff Double in 9th

headline.main: Colombia's FARC Rebels Ready to Return to War if Talks Fail: President
headline.print_headline: Colombia's FARC Rebels Ready to Return to War if Talks Fail: President

docs.snippet: Colombia's leftist FARC rebel group is prepared to return to the battlefield, especially in urban areas, if peace negotiations with the government fall apart, President Juan Manuel Santos said on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Colombia's leftist FARC rebel group is prepared to return to the battlefield, especially in urban areas, if peace negotiations with the government fall apart, President Juan Manuel Santos said on Thursday.
